markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 1"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Innocuous](/Feats.aspx?ID=1013) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Halfling" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=87" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Character Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=12) pg. 44 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Access**
Jaric ethnicity

</column>

---

Halflings have been unobtrusive assistants of larger folk for untold ages, and your people count on this assumption of innocence. You gain the trained proficiency rank in [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) (or another skill of your choice, if you’re already trained in Deception). If you fail a Deception check to Create a Diversion, humanoid creatures aren’t aware that you were trying to trick them unless you get a critical failure on your roll.
name: Innocuous

summary_markdown: Halflings have been unobtrusive assistants of larger folk for untold ages, and your people count on this assumption of innocence.
text: <title level="1" right="Feat 1" pfs="Standard" > Innocuous Source Character Guide pg. 44 2.0 Access Jaric ethnicity --- Halflings have been unobtrusive assistants of larger folk for untold ages, and your people count on this assumption of innocence. You gain the trained proficiency rank in Deception (or another skill of your choice, if you’re already trained in Deception). If you fail a Deception check to Create a Diversion, humanoid creatures aren’t aware that you were trying to trick them unless you get a critical failure on your roll.
